citation.article-title: Prochlorothrix hollandica gen. nov., sp. nov., a filamentous oxygenic photoautotrophic procaryote containing chlorophylls a and b: Assignment to Prochlororales Florenzano, Balloni, and Materassi 1986, with emendation of the ordinal description.

p.s: Description of Prochlorothrix hollandica sp. nov.
Prochlorothrix hollandica (hol. lan' di. ca. L. adj. hollandica, pertaining to Holland, part of The Netherlands)
Filamentous organism composed of cylindrical cells that are 0.5 to 1.5 μm wide and 3 to 10 μm long.
Unfavorable growth conditions may increase both the cell length and the cell diameter.
The straight undifferentiated trichomes are composed of 2 to more than 100 cells, depending on the degree of shearing that occurs as a result of stirring liquid cultures.
The trichomes lack sheaths, do not possess differentiated end cells, and are nonmotile.
The cell wall is characterized by both gram-positive and gram-negative features.
Periodic constrictions along the trichomes mark the locations of cross walls between adjacent cells.
The cross walls are formed by invagination of the cytoplasmic membrane and the peptidoglycan layer of the cell wall.
The outer layer of the cell wall does not participate in cross wall formation (Fig. 6).
Reproduction occurs by trichome fragmentation; motile hormogonia are not produced.
The thylakoid membranes are arranged in parallel layers at the periphery of the cytoplasm around a thylakoid-free central body (2).
The thylakoid membranes show lateral heterogeneity (Miller et al., in press).
Refractile cell inclusions of indefinite nature may be present.
Gas vacuoles are present at the polar ends of the cells.
Carboxysomes seem to be restricted to the center of the cells in the vicinity of the thylakoid membranes.
The nuclear region is located in the center of the cells (2).
The primary photosynthetic pigments, chlorophylls a and b, have a ratio of chlorophyll a to chlorophyll b ranging from 7:1 to 19:1.
Zeaxanthin and β-carotene are the major carotenoids; α-carotene, lutein, and echinenon are absent.
Dinitrogen fixation does not occur in media devoid of combined nitrogen, nor can nitrogenase activity be induced under anaerobic conditions.
Salt sensitive; 25 mM NaCl inhibits growth, and no growth occurs at 100 mM NaCl.
The optimum growth temperature is between 20 and 30°C, and the optimum pH is 8.4.
Isolated from a shallow, highly eutrophic freshwater lake in The Netherlands.
The G+C content of the DNA is 53 mol%, as determined by the thermal denaturation method (one strain).
The type strain has been deposited in the Culture Collection of Algae and Protozoa (Cumbria, United Kingdom) as strain CCAP 1490/1.
